author: News 3 Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Fantastic weather is in the forecast on Martin Luther King Jr Day with temperatures climbing throughout the week... We will wrap up the weekend with a storm moving in on Sunday...{/p}{p}TODAY: If you're heading downtown to the MLK Day Parade, temperatures will be around 50 degrees at 10 am. Expect partly cloudy skies on Monday with high temperatures reaching 58 degrees in Las Vegas. Winds will stay light out of the north up to 10 mph throughout the day.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' for most valley neighborhoods with levels 'unhealthy for sensitive groups' in the east valley. Pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold valley low temperatures dropping to around 39 degrees.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Temperatures will keep climbing throughout the work week with highs in the low to mid 60s as high pressure builds. A storm will move into the West Coast on Wednesday, bringing rain and snow showers to Northern Nevada. Temperatures will max out around 65 degrees on Saturday in Las Vegas, followed by a stronger storm moving into Southern Nevada on Sunday. A slight chance of rain showers will be possible in the valley on Sunday (about 20% chance) with light rain amounts anticipated. Forecast totals will be anything from a trace up to .10\". Mountain snow will be more likely on Sunday but the heaviest snow is forecast for the Sierra Mountains to our west. In between the two storms this week some parts of the Sierra will get up to 30\" of snow from now into the start of NEXT week.{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day forecast, rain shower chances will linger in Las Vegas Sunday through Monday with highs in the 50s. Conditions appear to clear up by NEXT Tuesday and Wednesday with valley highs rebounding back to the mid 60s under mostly sunny to partly cloudy skies.{/p}{p}Check back for more updates & have a great day!{/p}{p}- Chloe Koast{ }{/p}{p}{br}{/p}{p}The Nevada Department of Transportation (NDOT) is warning east valley drivers of some upcoming lane restrictions happening overnight on the I-515 this week.{/p}{p}According to officials, the restrictions will allow crews to resurface pavement{ }associated with the ongoing I-515 Wyoming to Sunset improvement project.{/p}{p}Restrictions include:{/p}{p}{strong}Sunday, January 14 at 8:00 p.m. to Monday, January 15 at 5:00 a.m.{/strong}{/p}{ul}{li}Southbound I-515 reduced to one lane between S Nellis Blvd and N Stephanie St{/li}{li}Northbound I-515 reduced to one lane between S Nellis Blvd and Flamingo Rd{/li}{li}Northbound I-515 off/onramps at Tropicana Ave and Flamingo Rd offramp closed{/li}{/ul}{p}{strong}Monday, January 15 at 8:00 p.m. to Tuesday, January 16 at 5:00 a.m.{/strong}{/p}{ul}{li}Southbound I-515 reduced to one lane between N Stephanie St and Sunset Rd{/li}{li}Northbound I-515 reduced to one lane between S Nellis Blvd and Flamingo Rd{/li}{li}Northbound I-515 off/onramps at Tropicana Ave and Flamingo Rd offramp closed{/li}{/ul}{p}{strong}Tuesday, January 16 at 8:00 p.m. to Wednesday, January 17 at 5:00 a.m.{/strong}{/p}{ul}{li}Southbound I-515 reduced to one lane between Flamingo Rd and S Nellis Blvd{/li}{li}Southbound I-515 off/onramps at Tropicana Ave and Flamingo Rd onramp closed{/li}{li}Northbound I-515 reduced to one lane between S Nellis Blvd and Flamingo Rd{/li}{/ul}{p}{strong}Wednesday, January 17 at 8:00 p.m. to Thursday, January 18 at 5:00 title=\"https://news3lv.com/news/local/improvement-project-traffic-signal-installation-brings-roadwork-on-monday-northwest-las-vegas-valley-grand-teton-drive-and-shaumber-road-intelligent-transportation-system#\"}{strong}Improvement project, traffic signal installation brings roadwork on Monday{/strong}{/a}{/p}{p}The I-515 (U.S. 95) from Sunset Road in Henderson to Wyoming Avenue Repaving Project consists of pavement preservation to improve the safety and rideability of I-515 by replacing mainline concrete slabs, repairing spalls, installing new high-mast lighting, and upgrading median barrier rail.{ }{br}{/p}{p}For the latest on projects happening along the I-515 corridor, click {a href=\"https://www.nv515.com/\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://www.nv515.com/\"}{strong}here.{/strong}{/a}{/p}{p}Fantastic weather is in the forecast on Martin Luther King Jr Day with temperatures climbing throughout the week... A storm will move into the West Coast on Wednesday, bringing rain and snow showers to Northern Nevada. Temperatures will max out around 65 degrees on Saturday in Las Vegas, followed by a stronger storm moving into Southern Nevada on Sunday. A slight chance of rain showers will be possible in the valley on Sunday (about 20% chance) with light rain amounts anticipated. Forecast totals will be anything from a trace up to .10\". Mountain snow will be more likely on Sunday but the heaviest snow is forecast for the Sierra Mountains to our west. In between the two storms this week some parts of the Sierra will get up to 30\" of snow from now into the start of NEXT week.{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day forecast, rain shower chances will linger in Las Vegas Sunday through Monday with highs in the 50s.
